Jekyll School

A simple, free way for students and teachers to learn to code, create and publish websites together

see how it works

As you make your website, you'll learn:

Github is where you manage and share code

Quickly create web content in Markdown

Style and develop your site with HTML5 and CSS3

Let's get started creating your site...

  1. Getting Started

    Create your account on Github with an individual name and a secure password.

    2.  

  2. Register Your Group

    Choose a free plan and then go on to create an organisation.

    3.  

  3. By Invite Only

    As your group members create individual accounts, you can send each one invitations to join the organisation.

    4.  

  4. Creating Your Fork

    Go to Jekyll School on Github and click on Fork in the top right.

    5.  

  5. Making It Unique

    Find _config.yml in the list, click on it then click on the pen in the top right to edit.
    You'll find instructions in the file.

    6.  

  6. Growing a Branch

    Add your group details and when you are happy save the changes as a new branch.

    7.  

  7. Submitting the Changes

    Create a pull request to submit the changes for inclusion in your website.

    8.  

  8. Making it Final

    Merge into your master branch to complete the Pull Request workflow. Thatâ€™s how your group will update the website too.
    You'll notice the admins monitor all the content before it goes online.

    9.  

  9. Write Something Great

    Got all the profile pages ready? Let's start writing.
    Create posts just like the examples, save them in a folder named after you inside _students or _admins. The date format in the filename is important.
    Create a new branch for it, make a Pull Request and you're done!

    10.  

  10. Published on the Internets!

    Head over to settings to rename the website. Use exactly the organisation name you chose in step 2.
    Your website's waiting for you now at orgname.github.io - congratulations!

Turn your site into whatever you want it to be, gaining skills along the way.
